TranscripTools 0.1.0

Create a Customized Heatmap for Count Data

hmap.Rd

This function generates a heatmap from a count matrix (e.g., TMM or TPM data), with the option to restrict to a set of differentially expressed genes (DEGs). In addition, it allows full customization of the heatmap colors and the top annotation.

Usage

hmap(
  tmm,
  title,
  deg = NULL,
  heatmap_colors = c("#5a78b3", "#6381b8", "#93b2d3", "#c6dbea", "#e7f4f2", "#faf0ab",
    "#f6e298", "#db7d54", "#c14536", "#b9332c"),
  top_annotation_df = NULL,
  top_annotation_colors = NULL,
  annotation_width = unit(c(1, 4), "cm")
)

Arguments

tmm

A numeric matrix or data frame with row names representing genes.

title

A character string to be used as the heatmap's column title.

deg

An optional character vector of gene names. If provided, only the rows (genes) present in deg will be used. If NULL (default), the heatmap will be created using all rows in tmm.

heatmap_colors

A character vector specifying the color palette for the heatmap. Default is a blue-to-red gradient.

top_annotation_df

An optional data frame for top annotation. For example, this could contain sample groupings. If NULL (default), no top annotation is added unless a global metadata$samples exists.

top_annotation_colors

A named list of colors for the annotation. Default is NULL, meaning no annotation colors are applied.

annotation_width

A unit object specifying the annotation width. Default is unit(c(1, 4), 'cm').

Value

A Heatmap object (from the ComplexHeatmap package) that is drawn and returned.

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  • Optionally subsets the count matrix tmm to include only rows in deg (if provided).

  • Computes z-scores for each gene across samples.

  • Optionally creates a top annotation if both top_annotation_df and top_annotation_colors are provided.

  • Draws a heatmap using the Heatmap function from the ComplexHeatmap package.

This flexibility allows users to visualize either the entire dataset or just a subset of DEGs, with full control over aesthetics.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example: Create a heatmap using all genes
ht_all <- hmap(tmm_avg, title = "Heatmap of All Genes")

# Example: Create a heatmap using only a subset of DEGs
deg_genes <- rownames(res_PB_vs_all)
ht_deg <- hmap(tmm_avg, title = "PB vs ALL - DEGs", deg = deg_genes,
               heatmap_colors = c("#4575b4", "#91bfdb", "#e0f3f8", "#fee090", "#fc8d59", "#d73027"),
               top_annotation_df = data.frame(Group = metadata$samples),
               top_annotation_colors = list(Group = c("PB" = "blue", "BM" = "red", "solid_tissues" = "green")))
} # }
